item.title: How to identify Anomalies/Outliers in Python
item.author: Will update soon (Mohit Sharma)
item.description:
Introduction

Data objects or points which exhibit very different behavior than the expectations are called as outliers or anomalies. They can indicate variability in the measurement, an error in the collection, a new point(due to some changes), or it could be true, which happens to be away from most of the observations.

Detecting and treating outliers is an important part of data exploration.

item.title: Non-Negative Matrix Factorization(NMF) - With Examples in Python
item.author: Will update soon (Mohit Sharma)
item.description: Non-Matrix Factorization, aka NMF, is a widely used algorithm for the analysis of non-negative high dimensional data. The algorithm is handy in extracting meaningful features from a non-negative matrix. It was first introduced in 1994 by Paatero and Tapper. The algorithm has been long used for extracting information from chemical systems using data-driven approaches under the name * self-modeling curve resolution*. It got its name as Non-Negative Matrix Factorization after a popular article from Lee and Seung in 1999. The paper discussed properties of the algorithm and published some simple and useful algorithms for two types of factorizations.[1]
